## Discussion

The property’s value is equivalent to the output from the `metal-arch` command line tool on the same system.

Apps can use this property’s value to make decisions at runtime. For example, an app could retrieve a GPU-specific file from its developer’s content delivery network (CDN), such as a shader library or binary archive. See [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/shader-libraries] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/shader-library-and-archive-creation] for more information.

# name

**Instance Property**

The name of a GPU device’s architecture.

## Declaration

```swift
var name: String { get }
```

## Discussion

The property’s value is equivalent to the output from the `metal-arch` command line tool on the same system.

```shell
% xcrun metal-arch
applegpu_g13s
```

Apps can use this property’s value to make decisions at runtime. For example, an app could retrieve a GPU-specific file from its developer’s content delivery network (CDN), such as a shader library or binary archive. See [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/shader-libraries] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/shader-library-and-archive-creation] for more information.
title: name
